meanings.definition: Property that is or can be inherited; an inheritance.
meanings.sent1: My grandmother left me a small piece of heritages in her will.
meanings.sent2: Families often pass down their heritages from one generation to the next.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally tripped over my heritages and almost dropped them.
meanings.sent4: The heritages of our ancestors are like precious gems, to be treasured and protected.
meanings.sent5: The old chest in the attic held a trove of mysterious heritages waiting to be discovered.

meanings.definition: Valued objects and qualities such as cultural traditions, unspoiled countryside, and historic buildings that have been passed down from previous generations.
meanings.sent1: The small town prided itself on preserving its unique heritages.
meanings.sent2: Tourists come from far and wide to experience the rich heritages of this region.
meanings.sent3: The heritages of the town were so old, even the buildings seemed to have stories to tell.
meanings.sent4: In the quiet countryside, the heritages of nature were on full display.
meanings.sent5: The heritages of the past whispered secrets of bygone eras to those who listened closely.
